intro: Aphloia seychellensis, commonly known as the Seychelles hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Aphloia seychellensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
